website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for a pure honey with a rich consistency, this product is worth considering. However, manuka honey is expensive, as it comes with health benefits.
pros: Sourced in New Zealand and tested for purity
Contains MGO, a natural compound touted for having healing properties
Some consumers reported noticeable results when used for skin irritations
Also nice for sweetening tea and coffee
cons: Expensive, plus you only get 8.8 oz

customer_reviews.title: My eight year old son has suffered with severe eczema ...
customer_reviews.text: My eight year old son has suffered with severe eczema since birth. He gets frequent skin infections. I worry about over use of antibiotic and steroids, so I've been trying to use more natural remedies. Last night, I tried this honey on his inflamed skin. This morning I can see a huge improvement (it's only been 12 hours).
customer_reviews.author: sparker326

customer_reviews.title: High quality product
customer_reviews.text: My husband uses this for his chronic gi troubles. He researched many brands and found that Manuka Heakty us one of the very best on the market. It definitely works very quickly to alleviate IBS, heartburn and acid indigestion. We are so thankful to have found this product!
customer_reviews.author: Homeschool Mama

customer_reviews.title: burns and blisters beautifully with no scars
customer_reviews.text: After experiencing several post-antibiotic related illnesses in our family, including c diff, we can no longer afford to rely on them to protect us from infection. It’s very important to me to prevent any cuts or scrapes from becoming infected, so I don’t hesitate to put a dab of this manuka on any of our wounds that have broken the skin. It works. I have watched it heal very gross looking skinned knees, burns and blisters beautifully with no scars. It does not work on fungal/yeast infections however, so for those I turn to essential oils.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: Loving Manuka Honey
customer_reviews.text: Husband had mrsa on arm and doctor cleaned it out. His arm ached and wasn't getting better so I packed it with Manuka Honey. The next morning it wasn't aching and when we cleaned it up the draining had stripped and it appeared to be healing. We repeated for about 3 days and his wound completely healed and closed. Since then it is out go to for anything we have happen to skin also we ingest it for stomach issues and throat. It is high priced but it's healing properties make it a valuable product to our home! ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
customer_reviews.author: Tibby Hollingsworth

customer_reviews.title: Miracle Worker
customer_reviews.text: My dog was attacked a few months ago and the veterinarian recommended that I get medical grade Minooka honey to applied to his open wound. My dog healed up twice as fast as I expected! We used this on his wound every time we did a dressing change which was about every other day. I’m so happy I bought this for him because he’s doing fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gunzenheiser

customer_reviews.title: Relieves eczema itch
customer_reviews.text: We apply this directly to my LO's eczema, it holds in moisture but more importantly it relieves the itch! Kiddo is 22 months and will hand the jar to me and ask me to dab it on when her skin is extra itchy. When it's less itchy, we use the organic manuka honey cream made by ZibaDel Creations since it isn't sticky.
customer_reviews.author: M Johnson

customer_reviews.title: People who use this on their toast should really look into what it is meant for.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing medicinal properties! Don't just consume on your toast, it is meant to be a healing property! I use this on acne and small cuts. Also works wonders for a sore throat. I also give this to my dog when she has digestive issues.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: First sign of a sore throat
customer_reviews.text: I take a little on the tip of a spoon and let it dissolve on my tong while swishing it around. Stops it before it starts, can't say that about any other cough drop. The taste is sour sweet (in a good way), since it is Flu season I just take a little every morning. This is one of these products that you have to experience for yourself, but there are many benefits you may find to be worth having.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred Apfel

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: So far....so good! Not a honey fan..... yet... this is doing something for me. I ate about a teaspoon when it first arrived... in about 10 mins I noticed that the pain that I was having from the area of infection had greatly reduced!! Also have been putting some on the area and it finally looks as though it is healing. About a week now and I am very happy that I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Renie

customer_reviews.title: Great, rich taste, a bit messy (without bandages) for external use.
customer_reviews.text: Good for internal use, a bit messy for external use, prefer the ointment for application to the skin.
customer_reviews.author: Millersdad

customer_reviews.title: truely a miracle
customer_reviews.text: Its a miracle, the things Ive read about this honey are so true. It heals any open wound so fast. I also use it when I get skin irritations, acne, I put it in my baths, drink it in my tea, and use it daily for a number of other things. I cant imagine life without it now.

customer_reviews.title: One of the worst, toxic polyester plastic jar.
customer_reviews.text: It's a good honey but company uses one of the worst, toxic PET (polyester) plastic #1. I was so disappointed. Will never buy again. On at least until they change the jar.

I did see somewhat of a small improvement, but unfortunately I did not see as much of an improvement as I had hoped. That is not to say it does not work, as everyone's skin is a different. Manuka honey does have a lot of health benefits however, so I will use it for that instead.

customer_reviews.title: Manuka honey for kitchen burns
customer_reviews.text: Roughly 30 hours ago I accidentally grabbed then 450 degree oven rack with my right thumb. I then grabbed regular honey to put on my burn while I got someone to run to the basement bathroom to get the Manuka Honey. I put Manuka Honey on the burn for approximately 5 hours inside a sterile wrap. Even though it initially had a large inch long blister, my thumb ceased to sting within 1 hour. I can see where I burned it but it is not red and I have almost nonexistent pain. I have used my thumb all day today.

customer_reviews.title: What momma likes, momma gets.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty obvious I buy Manuka honey for my mom who swears by it. It’s too sweet for me. We used to buy from local health food stores until I discovered the mgo/umf rating system, which store products seldom carry. My mom tried this the same day we received it and she loved the taste. Despite other reviews the contents were not half full but to the brim. Previous to this we had ordered the Kiva brand, which also seemed good but at a lower price point. I plan to try a few others that have umf ratings to see which packs the most punch in terms of quality and bucks.
customer_reviews.author: M M

customer_reviews.title: Watery honey unlike the past
customer_reviews.text: I have used it for over a year. It works pretty well in the first year for my boil. Usually it will heal in three days. However it doesn't work for me now. I notice recently the honey is not condensed and more watery.... I wonder if there is any change in raw materials/formula with the products? I hope they could use the same stuff like last year 2016.

I'm under the impression that the strength of the honey goes away when you get to the bottom and have to scrape honey out of the jar... you'll notice the difference when you use honey from a new jar!

The taste is good, too – some people may find it less sweet/more bitter, but I don't find it that bitter, really. I use it as a face mask and I eat it plain, and it's been great in both instances. I definitely recommend it, especially as I trust this company more than a company that only fills its jars 2/3 full. I'd definitely repurchase this.

product_meta.title: Manuka Health - MGO 400+ Manuka Honey, 100% Pure New Zealand Honey, 8.8 oz (250 g) (FFP)
feature_bullets: NATURE MEETS SCIENCE: Expertly crafted MGO 400+ Manuka Honey offers natural support for wellness with a taste of goodness.
NEW ZEALAND BORN: Our master beekeepers and bees are key to preserving the quality and natural properties of our Manuka honey.
MEASURING THE MAGIC: We judge Manuka honey based on the quantity of methylglyoxal, the "magic Manuka ingredient", for a precise measurement of potency and quality.
BEFORE REACHING YOUR DOORSTEP: Our honey undergoes independent quality testing in an ISO17025 accredited laboratory to ensure quality, purity, and safety.
MANUKA WAY OF LIFE: Our mission is to share the healing power of New Zealand nature to reconnect you with natural wellness.
